attributes.comment:
If aliens can pay thousands of dollars to enter the U.S. illegally or obtain status
fraudulently, then they can pay the pertinent fees. U.S. taxpayers should not
have to pay for the immigration or citizenship of aliens they have no ties with.
Fees can be waived for those that have a legitimate and documented need. For
an alien to enter the U.S. or become a U.S. citizen is a priviledge, not a right.
Perhaps if it were charged accordingly, people would take it more seriously. No
amount of money will allow you to reside, much less become a citizen, of other
countries.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
